project.name: iSurfer
project.description: iSurfer: is a program design for iOS to render algerbraic surfaces in a 3D space.

Engine.name: Engine
Engine.description:
This module is written in C++. it is in charge
of parsing initialize and generate some Data to use OpenGL.

Some parts are based on the book "iPhone 3D programming" from O'Reilly.
by dazar

Version: 1.0

Surface.name: Surface
Surface.description:
This module is written in C++. it is in charge
of Creating and compilling the shaders, and render them.
 by dazar

Version: 3.0

Parser.name: Parser
Parser.description:
This module is written in C. it is in charge
of parsing the function and generate shader code for it.

For this porpouse we use an expression tree. and some string filters on the formula.
by dazar

ApplicationEngine.name: ApplicationEngine
ApplicationEngine.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface provides access to a Matrix library. Matrix2, Matrix3, Matrix4.
It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming" with some added functionality like matrix inverse.

Matrix.name: Matrix
Matrix.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface provides access to a Matrix library. Matrix2, Matrix3, Matrix4.
It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming" with some added functionality like matrix inverse.

ParametricEquations.name: ParametricEquations
ParametricEquations.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This file contains some parametric surfaces. This surfaces can be used to pass vertex to OpenGL.
It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming".

It contains: Cone, Sphere, Torus, TrefoilKnot, MobiusStrip, KleinBottle

ParametricSurface.name: ParametricSurface
ParametricSurface.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface provides access to a Matrix library. Matrix2, Matrix3, Matrix4.
It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming" with some added functionality like matrix inverse.

QuaternionT.name: QuaternionT
QuaternionT.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
 -----------------------------------------------------
 This interface provides access to a Quaternion library.
 It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming".

Vector.name: Vector
Vector.description:
Last modified on February 13 2012 by dazar
 -----------------------------------------------------
 This interface provides access to a vector library. vec2, vec3, vec4.
 It is based on the book "iPhone 3D Programming" with some added operations to do operations between mat4 and vec4.

Compiler.name: Compiler
Compiler.description:
Last modified on December 5 2011 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface provides access the shader compiler. It is in charge of generating all the shader code from the algebraic surface equation.
Then it compiles it to the GPU.

Error.name: Error
Error.description:
Last modified on December 5 2011 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface simplify reading GPU errors.

programData.name: programData
programData.description:
Last modified on December 5 2011 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface is incharge of all the variables and information requiered to render a frame in OpenGL.

surfaceRender.name: surfaceRender
surfaceRender.description:
Last modified on December 5 2011 by dazar
-----------------------------------------------------
This interface is incharge of rendering a frame. 
It makes all the matrix necesary to render in Opengl.

exception.name: exception
exception.description:
Last modified on Thu Feb 23 12:45:01 1995 by eroberts
 -----------------------------------------------------
 The exception package provides a general exception
 handling mechanism for use with C that is portable
 across a variety of compilers and operating systems.

expressionT.name: expressionT
expressionT.description:
Last modified on November 12 2011 by dazar
 -----------------------------------------------------
 This interface provides access to an expression tree designed to parse algebraic surface equations.
 This tree has methods to dinamicaly generate shader code, derivate the expresion, etc.

genlib.name: genlib
genlib.description:
Last modified on Sun Jul 24 10:32:49 1994 by eroberts
-----------------------------------------------------
This file contains several definitions that form the
core of a general-purpose ANSI C library developed by Eric
Roberts.  The goal of this library is to provide a basic
set of tools and conventions that increase the readability
of C programs, particularly as they are used in a teaching
environment.

The basic definitions provided by genlib.h are:

   1.  Declarations for several new "primitive" types
       (most importantly bool and string) that are
       used throughout the other libraries and
       applications as fundamental types.

   2.  A new set of functions for memory allocation.

   3.  A function for error handling.

   4.  A repeat statement for loops with interior exits.

parser.name: parser
parser.description:
Last modified on FRY June 12 2012 by dazar
 -----------------------------------------------------
 This interface provides access to a simple package of
 functions that simplify the parser of equations from the file exp.

ScannerADT.name: ScannerADT
ScannerADT.description:
Type: scannerADT
----------------
This type is the abstract type used to represent a single instance
of a scanner.  As with any abstract type, the details of the
internal representation are hidden from the client.
This is modified by dazar to resolve some equation problems.

simpio.name: simpio
simpio.description:
Last modified on Wed Apr 27 07:29:13 1994 by eroberts
 -----------------------------------------------------
 This interface provides access to a simple package of
 functions that simplify the reading of input data.

strlib.name: strlib
strlib.description:
Version: 1.0
Last modified on Fri Jul 15 14:10:40 1994 by eroberts
-----------------------------------------------------
The strlib.h file defines the interface for a simple
string library.  In the context of this package, strings
are considered to be an abstract data type, which means
that the client relies only on the operations defined for
the type and not on the underlying representation.

classitems.description:
Usage: init(v1, f1,v2,f2,eq);
----------------------------------
Generate the needed shader code from the equation, reads shader files 
and compile 1 or two programs depending on if wireSphere is active or not.
classitems.name: init

params.description: vertex shader file name for isurfer.

params.name: fs1
params.description: fragment shader file name for isurfer.

params.name: fs2
params.description: fragment shader file name for wiresphere.

params.name: vs2
params.description: vertex shader file name for wiresphere.

classitems.description:
Usage: checkGLError( AT );
----------------------------------
Prints an error message depending on glGetError(). It also include the location, 
file and line number where the error was spotted.
classitems.name: checkGLError

params.description: vertex shader file name for isurfer.

classitems.description:
Usage: RaiseException(&e, name, value);
---------------------------------------
This function is called by the raise macro and does the
work necessary to raise the exception.  See the exception.c file
for details.  Clients do not ordinarily call this directly.
classitems.name: RaiseException

params.name: e
params.description: is the exception to be raised.

classitems.description:
Usage: if (HandlerExists(&e)) ...
---------------------------------
Determines whether a handler exists for an exception in
the dynamically enclosing scope.  Intended only for use
by special clients, such as the Error package.
classitems.name: HandlerExists

return.description:
a new tree.

Usage: expressionT myTree; myTree= NewTree();

--------------------------------------
This function creates a new tree.

classitems.name: PreOrder

classitems.description:
Usage: expressionT myTree; myTree= SubTree( "10", NULL, NULL);
--------------------------------------
Creates a Tree. Using raiz as the root and left and right as both childs.
Left and Right should be created before. If they are Null it is a leaf, a number or variable.
classitems.name: SubTree

params.name: left
params.description: the left child of the new tree.

params.name: right
params.description: the right child of the new tree.

classitems.name: EvalExp

params.name: where
params.description:
where to print the result. 

0 Means it is the algebraic surface. 

1 Means it is the algebraic surface derivate.

classitems.name: EvalExpNoCode

params.name: where
params.description:
where to print the result. 

0 Means it is the algebraic surface. 

1 Means it is the algebraic surface derivate.

classitems.description:
Usage: string = getCode();
--------------------------------------
Returns a string with the  algebraic surface generated.
It can be shader code or the expression.
classitems.name: getCode
EvalDegree
getCodeLeng

return.description: The length of the algebraic surface generated.

classitems.description:
Usage: clearExp();
--------------------------------------
clears all the memory to parse a new expression.
This method should be called before using any other method.
classitems.name: clearExp

classitems.description:
Usage: string = getCodeDerivate();
--------------------------------------
Returns a string with the  algebraic surface derivative generated.
It can be shader code or the expression.
classitems.name: getCodeDerivate
EvalDerivate
EvalDerivateNoCode
getDegree

classitems.description:
Usage: FreeTree();
--------------------------------------
Delete all the tree info and free the memory.
It should be called once and only on the root node of a tree.
classitems.name: FreeTree

classitems.description:
Usage: if(ErrorExist())
--------------------------------------
This should be called to look if there was an error in any of the methods of this class.
classitems.name: ErrorExist
getErrorMsg
ParseError

classitems.description:
Usage: ptr = (type) GetBlock(nbytes);
-------------------------------------
GetBlock allocates a block of memory of the given size.  If
no memory is available, GetBlock generates an error.
classitems.name: GetBlock

return.description: pointer no the newly allocated block.

classitems.description:
Usage: FreeBlock(ptr);
----------------------
FreeBlock frees the memory associated with ptr, which must
have been allocated using GetBlock, New, or NewArray.
classitems.name: FreeBlock

classitems.description:
Usage: Error(msg, ...)
----------------------
Error generates an error string, expanding % constructions
appearing in the error message string just as printf does.
If an error handler exception has been introduced (see the
"exception.h" facility), the ErrorException exception is
raised with the expanded error string as argument.  If
there is no ErrorException defined, the program exits
with a status code indicating failure (as given by the
constant ErrorExitStatus).  The length of the error
message string following expansion must not exceed
MaxErrorMessage, and it is the client's responsibility
to ensure this.
classitems.name: Error

params.name: msg
params.description: error message to be print in stderr.

classitems.description:
Usage: exp = ParseExp(scanner);
----------------------------
Reads the scanner and generates an expression tree with the equation.
The tree is formed with the correct precedence considering "(" and ")".
Returns Null in case of error.
classitems.name: ParseExp

params.name: scanner
params.description: a scanner with the equation formula.

classitems.description:
Usage: b = IsVariable(token);
----------------------------
IsVariable reads a char of text from the pointer and
returns a boolean indicating if it is a variable or not.
that terminates the input is not stored as part of the
A variable can be x, y ,z.
classitems.name: IsVariable

params.name: token
params.description: pointer to the char to analize.

classitems.description:
Usage: b = EsNumero(token);
----------------------------
IsVariable reads a number from the pointer and
returns a boolean indicating if it is a number or not.
The number is left in valor.
classitems.name: EsNumero

params.name: token
params.description: pointer to the char to analize.

params.name: valor
params.description: pointer where we place the number read.

return.description: if it can read the number

classitems.description:
Usage: scanner = NewScanner();
------------------------------
This function creates a new scanner instance.  All other functions
in this interface take this scanner value as their first argument
so that they can identify what particular instance of the scanner
is in use.  This design makes it possible for clients to have more
than one scanner process active at the same time.
classitems.name: NewScanner

return.description: a new instance of the scanner.

classitems.name: FreeScanner

classitems.description:
Usage: SetScannerString(scanner, str);
--------------------------------------
This function initializes the scanner so that it will start
extracting tokens from the string str. This method is modified to also reduce the equation.
and resolve a minus or negation from a "-".
classitems.name: SetScannerString

classitems.description:
Usage: token = ReadToken(scanner);
----------------------------------
This function returns the next token from scanner.  If
ReadToken is called when no tokens are available, it returns
the empty string.  The token returned by ReadToken is always
allocated in the heap, which means that clients can call
FreeBlock when the token is no longer needed.
classitems.name: ReadToken

classitems.description:
Usage: if (MoreTokensExist(scanner)) . . .
------------------------------------------
This function returns TRUE as long as there are additional
tokens for the scanner to read.
classitems.name: MoreTokensExist

return.description: returns TRUE as long as there are additional tokens for the scanner to read.

classitems.description:
Usage: SaveToken(scanner, token);
---------------------------------
This function stores the token in the scanner data structure
in such a way that the next time ReadToken is called, it will
return that token without reading any additional characters
from the input.
classitems.name: SaveToken

classitems.description:
Usage: SetScannerSpaceOption(scanner, option);
-----------------------------------------------
The SetScannerSpaceOption function controls whether the scanner
ignores whitespace characters or treats them as valid tokens.
By default, the ReadToken function treats whitespace characters,
such as spaces and tabs, just like any other punctuation mark.
If, however, you call

   SetScannerSpaceOption(scanner, IgnoreSpaces);

the scanner will skip over any white space before reading a token.
You can restore the original behavior by calling

   SetScannerSpaceOption(scanner, PreserveSpaces);

The GetScannerSpaceOption function returns the current setting
of this option.
classitems.name: SetScannerSpaceOption

classitems.description:
Usage: option = GetScannerSpaceOption(scanner);
-----------------------------------------------
The SetScannerSpaceOption function controls whether the scanner
ignores whitespace characters or treats them as valid tokens.
By default, the ReadToken function treats whitespace characters,
such as spaces and tabs, just like any other punctuation mark.
If, however, you call

   SetScannerSpaceOption(scanner, IgnoreSpaces);

the scanner will skip over any white space before reading a token.
You can restore the original behavior by calling

   SetScannerSpaceOption(scanner, PreserveSpaces);

The GetScannerSpaceOption function returns the current setting
of this option.
classitems.name: GetScannerSpaceOption

classitems.description:
Usage: i = GetInteger();
------------------------
GetInteger reads a line of text from standard input and scans
it as an integer.  The integer value is returned.  If an
integer cannot be scanned or if more characters follow the
number, the user is given a chance to retry.
classitems.name: GetInteger

classitems.description:
Usage: l = GetLong();
---------------------
GetLong reads a line of text from standard input and scans
it as a long integer.  The value is returned as a long.
If an integer cannot be scanned or if more characters follow
the number, the user is given a chance to retry.
classitems.name: GetLong

classitems.description:
Usage: x = GetReal();
---------------------
GetReal reads a line of text from standard input and scans
it as a double.  If the number cannot be scanned or if extra
characters follow after the number ends, the user is given
a chance to reenter the value.
classitems.name: GetReal

classitems.description:
Usage: s = GetLine();
---------------------
GetLine reads a line of text from standard input and returns
the line as a string.  The newline character that terminates
the input is not stored as part of the string.
classitems.name: GetLine

classitems.description:
Usage: s = ReadLine(infile);
----------------------------
ReadLine reads a line of text from the input file and
returns the line as a string.  The newline character
that terminates the input is not stored as part of the
string.  The ReadLine function returns NULL if infile
is at the end-of-file position.
classitems.name: ReadLine

classitems.description:
Usage: s = Concat(s1, s2);
--------------------------
This function concatenates two strings by joining them end
to end.  For example, Concat("ABC", "DE") returns the string
"ABCDE".
classitems.name: Concat

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: ch = IthChar(s, i);
--------------------------
This function returns the character at position i in the
string s.  It is included in the library to make the type
string a true abstract type in the sense that all of the
necessary operations can be invoked using functions. Calling
IthChar(s, i) is like selecting s[i], except that IthChar
checks to see if i is within the range of legal index
positions, which extend from 0 to StringLength(s).
IthChar(s, StringLength(s)) returns the null character
at the end of the string.
classitems.name: IthChar

classitems.description:
Usage: t = SubString(s, p1, p2);
--------------------------------
SubString returns a copy of the substring of s consisting
of the characters between index positions p1 and p2,
inclusive.  The following special cases apply:

1. If p1 is less than 0, it is assumed to be 0.
2. If p2 is greater than the index of the last string
   position, which is StringLength(s) - 1, then p2 is
   set equal to StringLength(s) - 1.
3. If p2 < p1, SubString returns the empty string.
classitems.name: SubString

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: s = CharToString(ch);
----------------------------
This function takes a single character and returns a
one-character string consisting of that character.  The
CharToString function is useful, for example, if you
need to concatenate a string and a character.  Since
Concat requires two strings, you must first convert
the character into a string.
classitems.name: CharToString

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.name: StringLength

classitems.description:
Usage: newstr = CopyString(s);
------------------------------
CopyString copies the string s into dynamically allocated
storage and returns the new string.  This function is not
ordinarily required if this package is used on its own,
but is often necessary when you are working with more than
one string package.
classitems.name: CopyString

classitems.description:
Usage: if (StringEqual(s1, s2)) ...
-----------------------------------
This function returns TRUE if the strings s1 and s2 are
equal.  For the strings to be considered equal, every
character in one string must precisely match the
corresponding character in the other.  Uppercase and
lowercase characters are considered to be different.
classitems.name: StringEqual

classitems.description:
Usage: if (StringCompare(s1, s2) < 0) ...
-----------------------------------------
This function returns a number less than 0 if string s1
comes before s2 in alphabetical order, 0 if they are equal,
and a number greater than 0 if s1 comes after s2.  The
ordering is determined by the internal representation used
for characters, which is usually ASCII.
classitems.name: StringCompare

classitems.description:
Usage: p = FindChar(ch, text, start);
-------------------------------------
Beginning at position start in the string text, this
function searches for the character ch and returns the
first index at which it appears or -1 if no match is
found.
classitems.name: FindChar

return.description: the first index at which ch appears or -1 if no match is found.

classitems.description:
Usage: p = FindString(str, text, start);
----------------------------------------
Beginning at position start in the string text, this
function searches for the string str and returns the
first index at which it appears or -1 if no match is
found.
classitems.name: FindString

return.description: the first index at which ch appears or -1 if no match is found.

classitems.description:
Usage: s = ConvertToLowerCase(s);
---------------------------------
This function returns a new string with all
alphabetic characters converted to lower case.
classitems.name: ConvertToLowerCase

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: s = ConvertToUpperCase(s);
---------------------------------
This function returns a new string with all
alphabetic characters converted to upper case.
classitems.name: ConvertToUpperCase

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: s = IntegerToString(n);
------------------------------
This function converts an integer into the corresponding
string of digits.  For example, IntegerToString(123)
returns "123" as a string.
classitems.name: IntegerToString

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: n = StringToInteger(s);
------------------------------
This function converts a string of digits into an integer.
If the string is not a legal integer or contains extraneous
characters, StringToInteger signals an error condition.
classitems.name: StringToInteger

return.description: with the number in the string.

classitems.description:
Usage: s = RealToString(d);
---------------------------
This function converts a floating-point number into the
corresponding string form.  For example, calling
RealToString(23.45) returns "23.45".  The conversion is
the same as that used for "%G" format in printf.
classitems.name: RealToString

return.description: a new string with the result.

classitems.description:
Usage: d = StringToReal(s);
---------------------------
This function converts a string representing a real number
into its corresponding value.  If the string is not a
legal floating-point number or if it contains extraneous
characters, StringToReal signals an error condition.
classitems.name: StringToReal

return.description: with the number in the string.

classitems.description:
View that displays the video. Should be set in the Interface builder for

Loads a video stored in the iphone 

The video gets initialized with default movie playback controls

 The video gets initialized with default movie playback controls

removes movie default controls in the movie view
sets a video in full screen mode

params.description: for fullscreen mode, NO for normal view
